title: How to Make Cannabutter in a Slow Cooker (Easy Crockpot Marijuana Butter)

steps.title: Preheat the oven
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 240 °F (116 °C) in order to decarb the cannabis. Decarboxylating the cannabis is necessary to activate its psychoactive components. If you make edibles with just raw marijuana, your edibles may be pretty lackluster. Toasting the cannabis in the oven will ensure that the THC in the cannabis is active and ready for you to make some tasty (and potent) edibles. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Break up the cannabis buds and scatter them in a single layer on a cookie sheet.
steps.content: Break up the cannabis buds and scatter them in a single layer on a cookie sheet. To do this, roll the buds between your hands over the cookie sheet. This breaks them apart into smaller pieces so that the cannabis is toasted evenly. [2] X Research source Try breaking down each bud into 2-3 separate pieces.

steps.title: Toast the cannabis for 40 minutes and then let it cool.
steps.content: Toast the cannabis for 40 minutes and then let it cool. Once your oven has reached 240 °F (116 °C), put the cookie sheet in the oven and let it sit for 40 minutes. Check on the cannabis periodically to see how it's toasting. Take it out of the oven after 40 minutes or when the cannabis has turned from green to golden brown. After, let the cannabis cool before proceeding to the next step. [3] X Research source Check on your cannabis after about 20 minutes.

steps.title: Grind your cannabis with a cannabis grinder.
steps.content: Grind your cannabis with a cannabis grinder. Measure out 1 ⁄ 4 ounce (7.1 g) of cannabis flower and put it in the grinder. Next, grind it until it has the consistency of dried oregano. [4] X Research source Avoid grinding it too fine, as this can bring out the herbal flavor of the flower in your butter. If you don't have a grinder , try ripping up the flower with your fingers.

steps.title: Add the butter and water to the slow cooker.
steps.content: Add the butter and water to the slow cooker. Combine 2 cups (470 mL) of water with 16 ounces (450 g) of unsalted butter (about 4 sticks) in the slow cooker. The water will prevent the butter and the cannabis from scalding during the cooking process, which can lower the potency of the cannabis.

steps.title: Turn the slow cooker on using the low heat setting and stir.
steps.content: Turn the slow cooker on using the low heat setting and stir. Make sure the temperature remains between 200–250 °F (93–121 °C). Let the butter melt before proceeding to the next step. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Add the ground cannabis to the slow cooker.
steps.content: Add the ground cannabis to the slow cooker. Pour all of your fresh, ground cannabis into the cooker and stir the ingredients together. Next, cover the slow cooker. [6] X Research source Using a slow cooker with a lid can help you mask the smell of the marijuana as it cooks, so this is a great option if you have roommates or live in an apartment.

steps.title: Check on the butter as it cooks and stir periodically.
steps.content: Check on the butter as it cooks and stir periodically. Do this to make sure the cannabutter doesn't burn or come to a boil. Both can lower the potency of your cannabutter, as too much heat can destroy the THC.

steps.title: Cook the cannabutter for 2-3 hours for low potency.
steps.content: Cook the cannabutter for 2-3 hours for low potency. The longer you cook your cannabutter, the higher the potency will be. If you're a cannabis beginner or just want lower potency cannabutter, cook the cannabutter for 2-3 hours. After cooking for 2-3 hours, check to see that the top layer of your cannabutter has turned from liquid to thick and solid. That's when you know it's ready.

steps.title: Cook it for 8 hours or leave it cooking overnight for maximum potency.
steps.content: Cook it for 8 hours or leave it cooking overnight for maximum potency. If you'd like to make stronger cannabutter, leave it on the slow cooker for up to 24 hours. Just make sure you keep an eye on it as it cooks. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Strain the liquid out of the cannabutter using a strainer.
steps.content: Strain the liquid out of the cannabutter using a strainer. Once the cannabutter is done cooking, grab a strainer and place it over a medium bowl in the sink. Next, line the bowl with a cheesecloth. Pour the contents of the slow cooker into the strainer. Strain the cannabutter for 5 minutes, leaving the strainer sitting over the bowl. [8] X Research source This filters out all of the excess plant material in your cannabutter.

steps.title: Cover the bowl and let it cool in the fridge for at least 3 hours.
steps.content: Cover the bowl and let it cool in the fridge for at least 3 hours. When cannabutter first comes out of the oven, it's still pretty watery. Cool it down in the oven so that it hardens and solidifies together. Before you do that, use tinfoil or plastic wrap to cover the bowl. Then, place it in the fridge for a minimum of 3 hours. You might try cooling it overnight to ensure the perfect texture.

steps.title: Take the marijuana butter out of the fridge and prep it for storage.
steps.content: Take the marijuana butter out of the fridge and prep it for storage. After cooling the butter for at least 3 hours, it should be pretty solid. Scrape the butter out of the bowl using a spatula and place it on a paper towel. Dry off any excess water on the butter block with another paper towel. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Store the cannabutter in the fridge or the freezer.
steps.content: Store the cannabutter in the fridge or the freezer. Wrap it in 2 layers of plastic wrap and keep it in an airtight container. Use the butter anytime you want to make a cannabis-infused meal or treat. [10] X Research source The butter will keep for 2 months in the fridge and up to 6 months in the freezer.
